title: Full Settlement Agreements, 2022: Q3, Q4, 2023: Q1

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to show the settlement agreements of the following:

1. John Doe, settled July 15, 2022
2. Julie Doe, settled July 27, 2022
3. Jane Doe, parent of a minor, settled August 29, 2022
4. AC and RC, guardians of a student, settled September 1, 2022
5. Student by CE and AM parents, settled October 24, 2022
6. A student by DG, parent, settled October 11, 2022
7. A student by AB, parent and GC, guardian, settled on December 1, 2022
8. Roman, Lucila settled on February 3, 2023
9. Student by FK and DB, parents settled on March 20, 2023
10. Student by RK, parent, settled on March 23, 2023

To aid in the search, I've attached a highlighted file indicating the specific settlements I seek. The record is from a previous CPS FOIA release (N013430-030523). 

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

1. Provide a list or records of all severance agreements including severance amounts and agreement dates from March 1, 2023 through June 30, 2023.
2. Provide a list or records of all settlements including settlement amounts and settlement dates from March 1, 2023 through June 30, 2023.

Severance and Settlement may be used interchangeably and I do not want to exclude one or the other. This request is not limited to union settlements.

Because this request is in the public interest for Illinois nonprofit The FOIA Bakery’s work to advocate for public education, please waive any fees in accordance with 5 ILCS § 140/6(c). Feel free to contact me with any questions, or if clarification is needed.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Miriam Bhimani

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Alfred “Al” Hansen FBI file
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I am requesting any and all FBI documents pertaining to artist Alfred “Al” Hansen, pursuant to a biography I am writing on deadline for Simon & Schuster. Hansen was born in Queens, NYC, in 1927 and died in Cologne, Germany, in 1995. He traveled extensively and had radical companions, so I believe the Bureau possesses documents about or related to him, including a file on him, individually.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Abraham Riesman
